SIOUX CITY WOMAN SEEKS TO EDUCATE OTHERS ABOUT ATAXIA
June 01, 2014 4:00 pm  • 
BY DOLLY A. BUTZ dbutz@siouxcityjournal.com
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZtRkAmjvtLs&feature=youtube_gdata_player
http://siouxcityjournal.com/news/local/video-ataxia/youtube_9be35c04-3841-5033-a6c9-18e4dc0e522d.html
http://tinyurl.com/ksoa6j7
For more information about ataxia, go to siouxcityjournal.com. Susan Shacka talks about her disease.
Related Links
•	Susan Shacka's Facebook page Ataxians Helping Other ataxians
SIOUX CITY |  For years Susan Shacka worked as a secretary in Orange County, Calif. Now, the 56-year-old types with one finger.
Her speech is slow and choppy. Her gait is staggering as she moves about her quaint northside apartment, steadying herself on the back of a chair.
Everyday tasks like putting the cap back on a tube of toothpaste and cooking a meal are a struggle for Shacka.
The Council Bluffs, Iowa, native, who moved to Sioux City in 2012 to be closer to family when her tremors worsened, suffers from a rare form of ataxia -- a degenerative disease of the nervous system that affects her movement and balance.
"I had tremors. My handwriting was getting worse. I was dropping cell phones. I knew I had a problem," Shacka said in slow choppy speech as she sat at her computer.
Since the closest support group for people suffering from ataxia is over three hours away in Des Moines, Shacka turned to the Internet to gain support and spread awareness. She formed the community page: "Ataxians Helping Other Ataxians" on Facebook to communicate with others around the world who share her condition.
"My mission is to get the word out. This could happen to them," she said.
According to the National Ataxia Foundation, an estimated 150,000 Americans are affected by some form of ataxia, which is most often caused by a loss of function in the cerebellum.
Ataxia, which can be hereditary or sporadic, often begins in an individual's 20s and 30s, but a person may not show symptoms until their 60s. Children also suffer from ataxia.
Elizabeth Hartman, Shacka's neurologist at CNOS is Dakota Dunes, said genetic disorders, stroke and diseases such as multiple sclerosis can cause ataxia. Shacka, she believes, has an autoimmune form of ataxia.
Shacka lost 80 pounds in 2009 after lap-band surgery, then her health rapidly declined. She developed Guillain Barre Syndrome, an autoimmune disorder where the body's immune system attacks part of the peripheral nervous system which connects the central nervous system to the limbs and organs. Shacka spent eight months in a skilled nursing facility learning how to stand and walk again.
Toward the end of 2011, Shacka noticed her hands had begun to shake. Trouble swallowing and slurred speech followed. After nearly eight months of appointments and testing, she was diagnosed with ataxia at the University of Nebraska Medical Center. Shacka, who receives physical, occupational and speech therapy, said her condition hasn't worsened or improved.
According to Hartman, current ataxia research is focusing on deep brain stimulation. Results, she said, have been mixed so far.
Physical therapy, she said, is a "mainstay" of treatment because it can improve muscle strength and decrease the risk of falls in patients who struggle with walking and balance.
"Some of our patients need to have an assist device like a walker or even a cane that can help them walk as well," she said.
Shacka, who uses a walker outside of her apartment, longs for a cure and to return to the life she lived before ataxia.
"I want to write and I want to type. I want a job. I don't want to be on disability the rest of my life," she said.

Susan Shacka  *  712-560-1518  *  Iowasue57@yahoo.com

I don't listen to clear channel stations because they tend to play the same music over and over.

Another Hip Hop Station?? Really?? Is that what we need??

This past week here in San Antonio Clear Channel Radio debuted a new Rhythmic "Hip Hop and Throwback oldies" station on 104.5FM, which replaces a long time Rocker KZEP, which has been relegated to a lesser 93.3FM repeater frequency. Come on Clear Channel is that the best you can do? Really???

They really dropped the ball with a Hip Hop format!!

News Flash Clear Channel: The majority of people over 35 years old are not into Hip Hop!! Isn't one Hip Hop station here (98.5 the Beat www.thebeatsa.com) enough? Who are your consultants making these kind of stupid decisions? Did anyone ask the listeners of this region what they need in the FM market here? I talk to people in San Antonio everyday about what this radio market needs, and an over whelming majority agree that R&B and Smooth Jazz stations in particular are missing from this airwaves in this market.

It's been over five years now since Clear Channel made the decision to take away KSJL, which was the only R&B station left in the region. Somehow they felt that they could not sell "R&B" radio in this market, so after this long hiatus I suppose the powers that be seem to be awakening to the fact that it really doesn't make good business sense to continue to simply ignore over 300,000 Black, Hispanic and White households in the greater San Antonio area that used to listen to R&B music. Yes, as quiet as it me be kept, some Mexican and White households also listen to R&B music. While taking away the city's only R&B station was not a good idea, it really isn't the smartest move to now bring a second Hip Hop station into the market without have anything for adult R&B listeners to listen to.

Now just over a year ago in Austin Entercom started a R&B for adults (www.963rnb.com) which currently now has a listenership of over a 50% share of the urban market in that city. What's wrong with San Antonio? Wake up and understand that only kids are into Hip Hop and they have a station, what about the grown folks with disposable income that continue to be ignored on the FM airwaves here? Oh, well, I guess it will take them another 5-10 years to learn what this market really needs.

The music on the airwaves in the San Antonio region is awful when compared to other cities of a similar size. So many people listen to out of town Satellite/XM radio, Pandora, and other internet radio stations. Some even listen to Cable TV music because the music here is so bad!! For far too long there has be a very strong monopoly of the radio market here primarily by two big corporations, Clear Channel and Cox radio. They don't want any outside competition, and they won't change their ways, even when the public has been on their case about it for years. As long as they can make the lions share of the radio profits in San Antonio they seem to say, if it ain't broke, why try to fix it. Unfortunately, that's not reality, and I think they are slowly realizing this.

I started and internet radio station, www.1067thebridge.com in 2010 to help balance out this lopsided radio market here in San Antonio and beyond where there aren't R&B stations. We also play Smooth Jazz and Gospel music on the weekend. This is because no station is playing this kind of music exclusively among the FM stations here in San Antonio. I have wanted to take my format to the FM radio here, but no one in the large corporations would even listen to me to let me pitch them the format for their consideration. Dan Lawrie, the head of Cox Radio in San Antonio, hung up on me when I tried to ask him for a meeting to talk about radio in San Antonio.

He said he didn't even what to listen to anything that I had to say, despite the fact that I've worked on the air in several radio markets (Washington, DC, Cleveland, Columbus, VA Beach and San Antonio) and my 30 years in the business didn't even merit me a courtesy meeting about it with Cox Radio here in San Antonio. I haven't got the money to buy my own station here, so I'm doing the next best thing, which is broadcasting on the internet. It's a great new medium, and it allows people from all over the world to listen in. In time, internet radio may eventually eclipse terrestrial (AM/FM) radio.

It seems that my work will and must continue. In the meantime, we here at the Bridge will continue to bridge the musical gaps here and beyond with my online radio station, www.1067thebridge.com, that continues to play R&B music for adults who don't want to hear a bunch of profanity and "stupid" music, which is what most of today's Hip Hop music brings to our community. Sorry, but I just had to go there!! I strive to bring music and information that is uplifting and positive for everyone in general and the Black Community in particular. I think "Classy" radio is solely missing from the airwaves today because most big corporations have simply sold the concept of responsible broadcasting out for the money that people with no moral values will throw at them. Do our young women need to be schooled on the latest "twerking" dance? Really? is that that best we can do for our young people?

I say we as broadcasters can do better, we can elevate what radio delivers to its audience and we can help the community to improve, not just stay stuck on stupid!! I for one will not play exploitation music that sells our people out!! I also know that if you listen to more positive radio formats, then you will love it and get some enlightenment along the way.

Please drop by the Bridge anytime and check out for yourself what I'm talking about!! Just click on this link: www.1067thebridge.com. I hope you'll support our efforts and help us stay in a place to offer an alternative to the status quo of crappy radio that dominates San Antonio's radio airwaves these days!! I hope to eventually raise enough money to buy an FM station to fight for a real R&B radio station in San Antonio, however, since that's a tall order, in the meantime I'll keep doing what we do here on the internet. Thanks for letting me vent!!

Yesterday I had a minor shock when i saw the billboards advertising for the swedish racist party Sverigedemokraterna (Swedish Democrates).
The poster say's: Stop the organized begging.

There exists no such evidence for this racist and hostile lie.
We are many people that are frightened and angry over this "commercial" .
In Sweden the racist (sometimes leathal) violence has increased the past years, alongside with Sverigedemokraterna gaining more ground and making bolder and bolder statements based on lies and racism. These two are intimately linked and research shows an obvious connection to increasing fascism in suits and increasing fascism on the streets with murder as a consequnece. 
The situation is very grave.

Clear Channel is indirectly sanctioning this development by allowing these ads.

During the election tour for Sverigedemokraterna people in all city's across Sweden have protested and their meetings have often been cancelled.
You have a choice to act for democracy and the equality for every human being. Let's hope you make that choice.

Sofia Carlev

ONCE AGAIN MIKE BROOMHEAD IS OFF THE MARK AND WRONG

FOR IMMEDIATE PRESS RELEASE - BUNDY RANGE WAR - 4-25-14
We are trading one form of slavery for another.
What I am saying is that all we Americans are trading one form of slavery for another. All of us are in some measure slaves of the federal government. Through their oppressive tactics of telling the ranchers how many cows they can have on their land, and making that number too low to support a ranch, the BLM has driven every rancher in Clark County off the land, except me. The IRS keeps the people of America in fear, and makes us all work about a third or a half of the year before we have earned enough to pay their taxes. This is nothing but slavery from January through May. The NSA spies on us and collects our private phone calls and emails. And the government dole which many people in America are on, and have been for much of their lives, is dehumanizing and degrading. It takes away incentive to work and self respect. Eventually a person on the dole becomes a ward of the government, because his only source of income is a dole from the government. Once the government has you in that position, you are its slave.
I am trying to keep Martin Luther King Jr.'s dream alive. He was praying for the day when he and his people would be free, and he could say I’m free, free at last, thank God I’m free at last! But all of us here America, no matter our race, are having our freedom eroded and destroyed by the federal government because of its heavy handed tactics. The BLM, the IRS, the NSA--all of the federal agencies are destroying our freedom. I am standing up against their bad and unconstitutional laws, just like Rosa Parks did when she refused to sit in the back of the bus. She started a revolution in America, the civil rights movement, which freed the black people from much of the oppression they were suffering. I'm saying Martin Luther King's dream was not that Rosa could take her rightful seat in the front of the bus, but his dream was that she could take any seat on the bus and I would be honored to sit beside her. I am doing the same thing Rosa Parks did--I am standing up against bad laws which dehumanize us and destroy our freedom. Just like the Minutemen at Lexington and Concord, we are saying no to an oppressive government which considers us to be slaves rather than free men.
I invite all people in America to join in our peaceful revolution to regain our freedom. That is how America was started, and we need to keep that tradition alive.
Cliven D. Bundy

Parents in Chicago Tell Clear Channel: Stop Persuading Our Kids to Kill Each Other

Most hip-hop enthusiasts have been astonished by the way the genre has evolved over the last 20 years.  The music went from telling kids to have fun in the park or engage in activism, to telling them to use drugs all day and blow each other’s brains out. Most psychologists and marketing scholars know that this kind of influence on young people breeds a desensitization to violence and deviant behavior.

A group of parents, consisting of Lauren Horst and other concerned citizens of Chicago, have had enough.  The group is asking Clear Channel to show more responsibility in the kinds of music it selects to be played on both WGCI and the Big Jam Concert that is coming up this year.  The group also says that it is no coincidence that most of the violent lyrics speak of black-on-black violence, but the stations would likely not allow lyrics that promote black-on-white violence or black-on-gay attacks.

Here is the letter below.  You can join the conversation on their Facebook page: 

Open Letter to Clear Channel concerning the content of the music played on WGCI and the upcoming Big Jam Concert!!

Concerned Citizens Against Violence, Clear The Airwaves Project and Substance Over Nonsense along with other community groups are asking Clear Channel to PLEASE discontinue broadcasting music that is disrespectful to your listeners. The mere fact is that there is rash of violence, broken families, drug used and s****l exploitation going in the society. While Black People are disproportionately affected, they are not the only group that is been affected by these dysfunction symptoms. There are other races that are listening to this music that are trying to cope with the negative behaviors often imitated from the music. In just about every song in the urban/hiphop market that Clear Channel owns and operates the topics are either about violence, s*x drugs or disrespecting women. The violence is about Black on Black violence I never hear lyrics about someone committed a violent act on a white person it is almost always N***er(a) nor is White on White violence a theme on your stations. It will not be tolerated, because it is disrespectful. It does not matter what race is the focus on the lyrics, it is still disrespectful and unnacceptable. Why are positive artist, such as Lupe Fiasco not getting airplay on your urban stations? We only hear the negative artist. Because these negative groups are the vast majority of the artist played on your stations our youth are don’t have much of a choice but to listen to 2chainz, Meek Millz and etc.

Most hip-hop enthusiasts have been astonished by the way the genre has evolved over the last 20 years.  The music went from telling kids to have fun in the park or engage in activism, to telling them to use drugs all day and blow each other’s brains out. Most psychologists and marketing scholars know that this kind of influence on young people breeds a desensitization to violence and deviant behavior.

A group of parents, consisting of Lauren Horst and other concerned citizens of Chicago, have had enough.  The group is asking Clear Channel to show more responsibility in the kinds of music it selects to be played on both WGCI and the Big Jam Concert that is coming up this year.  The group also says that it is no coincidence that most of the violent lyrics speak of black-on-black violence, but the stations would likely not allow lyrics that promote black-on-white violence or black-on-gay attacks.

Here is the letter below.  You can join the conversation on their Facebook page: 

Open Letter to Clear Channel concerning the content of the music played on WGCI and the upcoming Big Jam Concert!!

Concerned Citizens Against Violence, Clear The Airwaves Project and Substance Over Nonsense along with other community groups are asking Clear Channel to PLEASE discontinue broadcasting music that is disrespectful to your listeners. The mere fact is that there is rash of violence, broken families, drug used and s****l exploitation going in the society. While Black People are disproportionately affected, they are not the only group that is been affected by these dysfunction symptoms. There are other races that are listening to this music that are trying to cope with the negative behaviors often imitated from the music. In just about every song in the urban/hiphop market that Clear Channel owns and operates the topics are either about violence, s*x drugs or disrespecting women. The violence is about Black on Black violence I never hear lyrics about someone committed a violent act on a white person it is almost always N***er(a) nor is White on White violence a theme on your stations. It will not be tolerated, because it is disrespectful. It does not matter what race is the focus on the lyrics, it is still disrespectful and unnacceptable. Why are positive artist, such as Lupe Fiasco not getting airplay on your urban stations? We only hear the negative artist. Because these negative groups are the vast majority of the artist played on your stations our youth are don’t have much of a choice but to listen to 2chainz, Meek Millz and etc.

The following is a complaint I tried to make against KFI640 but there are no ways to contact them and the corporate offices allow only 500 characters.Clearly, Clear Channel has something to hide.

Wednesday, June 26, 2013

To Whom It May Concern: 
	This message will also be printed and the hard copy sent to your radio station as well as your corporate offices. It deals with the absolute disgust I felt this afternoon as I listened to your program at approximately 4:00(pm) and the nausea it continues to produce as I think of it at this moment. I am somewhat familiar with your personalities but am uncertain if the person on air was Bill Carroll, Bill Handle or John or Ken but there was a female co-host who made equally disturbing comments and I wanted let all of you know how pitifully unprofessional you sounded.

	Let me preference this further by stating with absolute certainty that were I involved in the decision making process at KFI, everyone involved in today’s production would be out of a job. Unfortunately, I am not but may I suggest that each of you formally apologize to your listening audience for your crude, insensitive and crass comments. Apologize to the citizens of this country for the degrading manner used as you totally disrespected the United States Constitution, minimized the principles that govern this nation and spoke in a treasonous form that should have had you brought up on charges. There is no excuse for you behavior.

Now, the topic that were so offensive, dealt with the homeless and I need to say; up front that each of you have a right to state your opinion on whatever subject you choose but you had damn well understand that you are in a position to be heard where most are not and you need to remember those facts. The fact that many people are too foolish to understand that you are not reporting the news but are simply commenting on it is irrelevant. The fact that you are supposed to be very high paid professionals with concern for fellow human beings and who love their country, is a relevant fact and you failed on all parts this afternoon and I intend on pointing this out in detail.

My recall of the comments may not be verbatim and I was only able to stomach the program for 20 minutes but the persons involved will remember and will recall every syllable and my hope is that great suffering comes as a result of my words. To the on air personalities, I say, “Pay attention … you pathetic excuse for a civilized human being”. To the station manager, I offer this advice, Do your job and hold the people under you accountable for their actions. To those individuals in the corporate tier, I ask …”Is it your policy to have anti-American people who have no feelings for anyone other than themselves as they bring shame and embarrassment to your company, also an important factor to your stock holders”. I seriously doubt this is a possibility.

This afternoon and in heavy traffic, as I listened to KFI, I became so enraged that I had to pull from the road to compose myself. I was beside myself as I listened to a gentleman, on air say,:”Homeless people are a menace and should be ignored”, or something to that effect. He went on to suggest that the homeless coalition was a criminal enterprise whose only goal was to spread propaganda. He suggested that it was perfectly fine to have to police remove a homeless person from an area for nothing more than begging for something to eat.

continued ...

His unbelievable assertion that most homeless people suffer from a mental condition and should therefore be shunned by everyone; telling a caller to avoid speaking to any homeless person, caused me to yell aloud, “What !” Believing I had heard the worst was a foolish assumption on my part because it got more horrific as long as this idiot spoke. I had no choice other that to pull into a parking lot and shut my radio off when I heard him say the most outlandish thing I have ever (in 53 years), heard anyone say, especially on the radio.

“Homeless people deserve no help and it is a good thing when the police take them away … they should all be arrested because … what is the guy gonna do? Claim his rights were violated?  Homeless people have no rights and who cares about violating their rights, they are an annoyance”. Just prior to my turning the radio off, a female announced had the presence to chime in with a jovial comment about witnessing a police or sheriffs officer harassing a homeless person and they all treated the topic like it was a freak show at a carnival and that the Constitution and Bill of Rights was something they had read from the back of their ticket stub.

How dare you people disrespect my country!?  Who the hell gives you the right to decide which people deserve kindness and charity? Have you always been a pompously arrogant asshole that has convinced him … or her-self that your farts are different from everyone else because they do not stink? I have news for you both because they do stink just like everyone’s but you are different as you contend. Unique, actually because you have actually reached a place that classifies you as the only two people on this planet that I would loathe any time in your presence.

That is correct, the most despicable people on the planet, worse than George W. Bush or Barack Obama. No, I do not have a political affiliation that I blindly follow and I call it as it is observed. A thief is a thief, a liar is a liar and pathetic individuals are scum and that is where you are identified. No, I am not finished yet, you need to hear a rebuttal to your stupidity and understand that being a moron is no excuse and become fully aware that you are actually nothing more that the ‘no-bodies’ you denigrate with your filthy words.

Allow me to point out a few things that you have obviously overlooked so … wake up and pay attention, this is important. Your insane belief that people really want to be homeless if they are homeless proves the level of stupidity and I speak from experience. Being homeless is not as glamorous as you might think and in fact, it is as pathetic an existence as you could possibly imagine in your worst nightmare. Yes, I lived as a homeless person for ten very long months. Did I need help? You can bet your ass I did but get that help, I did not.
 continued ...

What I mean by that is, even if you weren’t beaten up by the police then it is a good chance that someone on the street has assaulted you and probably at night. Now, before you begin to blame that sort of an attack on another homeless person, think again because 99% of the time, it will be from a normal person. Someone half drunk or just kids wanting to be mischievous but either way, who cares, they will get away with it because, ‘Who Ya’ Gonna turn to for help, the Police? And also by this time, all those specific items you chose to save from extinction at the beginning of the ordeal have been long gone for some time.

More than likely, stolen from you when you had your back turned or even out right robbed; strong armed style and that meant you had to start all over. That probably explains to pitiful way you are dressed but you might feel good about the amount of weight you have lost since thus began and so you start to calculate the exact amount you have lost and realize that you have lived on the streets for nearly a half a year and the only possible thing you could accomplish is to simply survive from day to day. You’ve come to understand that no business will hire you because they couldn’t.

You look at yourself and wonder what would the people who worked there, think if you showed up everyday for work, pushing a shopping cart that you had to bring inside to keep from having it stolen and wearing the same clothes every single day … plus, that smell? You might start to question your use of time and wonder why nothing had gotten any better. That may be the point that you realize that had you not collected recyclables and traveled to great distance to sell them and traveled the great distance for a free meal that you would probably have starved to death and then … and only then, will you realize how badly you had acted towards people in need.

As for that bonehead notion of who has rights and who cares if some are violated and what is a homeless person to do if his rights are violated, I will answer this question and you had better pay attention. You sonofabitch, You are supposed to care, You are supposed to stand for your brother when you see this happen. You are to be the one he comes to for help and You should cherish the opportunity to help in any way you can and without limitations because you may one day find yourself in his shoes you sonofabitch!

Trust me, I know you all think the same way and that includes that idiot Bill Handle because if he were any sort of a decent Lawyer, he’d know that it is illegal to violate a persons rights. It is also illegal to suggest or coerce others to violate the rights of ANYONE and you did just that, so do you turn yourself in or make it right? I doubt any of you have the guts to turn yourselves in for breaking the law but you may be able to muster the courage to apologize and start doing the right things in life. God, I hope so because I am sick up to my eyeballs with the propaganda this radio spews out all day long, it’s sickening.

Why don’t you do what is right for this country like demanding criminal Politicians be removed from office and that any, past or present violators be prosecuted in the same way they would gladly prosecute you or I without a thought. Try and understand this one simple statement:

“There, but for the Grace of God, go I.”

Geez, where did you people come from?

			Still disgusted after six pages,

			Kenneth Pressley

Sorry but I prefer Winamp or Windows Media not the web, so I guess I won't be listening to any of your stations online or on my radio either. Wnhy woul dyou force the hand of YOUR CUSTOMERS? Really?

Dear Clear Channel, I’m a citizen of Jacksonville, FL and I am aware of the great partnerships you have established in my community.  However, I have also recently discovered that your company is Jacksonville’s number one broadcaster of toxic and negative content on the radio.  Credible research has been completed on the content of music that you allow to air on our radio stations (please click on link below to read Appeal Letter and statistics) and I am outraged at the results.  This content promotes violence, drug and alcohol abuse, hypersexuality and misogyny, and criminal activity.  

Although your initial response might be, “Well, it’s all about free speech and not censoring art…”, this is not the initial response of the hundreds of parents in Jacksonville who have lost their children to senseless violence.  Can you honestly look these parents in their faces and tell them that their precious children died because of free speech?  Have you ever talked to a mother who lost her son because someone blew his brains out for “snitching” to the police?  Have you ever talked to a father who’s daughter was viciously raped by five men because they felt entitled to her body because she’s “just another b*$#@!”?   

I’m bringing this to your attention because I’m choosing to believe that perhaps you are not aware of what is broadcasted here in Jacksonville.  This music is harming my community and I’m pleading with you to help us.  The Appeal Letter below doesn’t just present a problem to you but also provides solutions.  Thank you for your time.  

http://www.thechurchgroup.com/docs/Clear-Channel-Appeal-4-26-13.pdf

Faith Joyner

Dear Clear Channel CEOs Bob Pittman and William Eccleshare,

I am writing to demand that you take down the billboards that have cropped up in Black and Latino neighborhoods in recent weeks and that employ tactics meant to scare people away from voting. While you may not have crafted the message, your company is in fact the messenger.

These billboards, which read "Voter Fraud is a Felony," are clearly designed to intimidate voters of color and keep those communities away from the polls. That these billboards did not appear in white or suburban neighborhoods is proof of their discriminatory nature.

Allowing an anonymous advertiser to create an atmosphere of fear around voting just as the early voting period begins is unacceptable. I ask that you remove these billboards at once. I know that in the past, you have rejected billboard ads when leadership in your company deemed the content to be politically charged. This campaign of misinformation fits that criteria and is a dangerous disservice to the Black and Latino communities in which they are placed.

Please remove these billboards immediately.

Sincerely,

We're having a benefit for an incredible young man who was diagnosed with Idiopathic Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia when he was 7 months old.  This condition causes a drop in the number of red blood cells due to increased destruction by the body's immune system.  
Often children with this condition get better as they grow older but in Landon's case we can't find a cause or a cure.  In order to keep Landon stable he has undergone a number of surgeries, chemotherapy, and many blood and plasma transfusions.
Funds raised help support the family through extended hospital stays, Dr's visits, transportation needs and other expenses.

We're having a benefit for him and reaching out to people asking for donations or help making this benefit a successful one.

You can take a look at the event here at Landon Pemberton's Benefit & Birthday Bash. We're having B-B-Que, Cakewalk, Bouncy House, Raffles, 
face-painting, hair-painting and lots lots more fun activities for you and your kids to enjoy.

To read more about Landon's condition you can take a look at his website http://www.landonshope.com/

Thank you for stopping to just read this.
Any help is greatly appreciated.
& we'll be glad to see you out there.

Thank you for your comments. Below is the statement made about Regular Guys in Atlanta, by Pat McDonnell, Clear Channel Radio-Atlanta:

In line with our zero tolerance policy and after conducting a thorough investigation of a March 19th broadcast on WKLS-FM, we have decided we will no longer broadcast the "The Regular Guys”. We will announce replacement programming in the near future, but remain confident in our ability to continue to provide compelling, entertaining and informative programming that meets the tastes and desires of our listeners.

o whoever made the decision to change Project 961 to a pop station: As I am sure you can tell, you have made a grave mistake. You have people threatening to boycott your entire company AS WELL AS your advertisers companies and products if you do not resurrect The Project and rehire everyone who worked there. I'm sure that you understand that a boycott of your company AND your advertisers would be not only be harmful to your profits (which it seems that is all you care about due to the lack of notice given to us, the customer and listeners) and be harmful to your advertisers, but it would also be bad for the business's reputation in the sense of having terrible customer relations therefore losing you even more money AND advertisers in the future. I urge you to reconsider before this begins to effect your company. We want our Family back and we will do whatever it takes to do so.

data.message: Hey clear channel, go take a look at Bring Back Nashville57 to SiriusXM Radio! We all want our Nashville57 back on SiriusXM.

You're promoting your FREE service, iheartradio! We PAY for satellite radio for the purpose of listening to the Nashville Channel! So, if everyone cancels their subscription and just uses iheartradio, how will you make any money. We don't pay for the privilege of satellite radio to hear free FM channels. Anybody can listen to wsix for free any day of the week. No matter how you look at the situation, it was a bad business decision and can only be rectified by restoring the Nashville Channel. Put it on channel 55 which currently does not have a station airing. That way, we get our station back and you get people to continue paying for  your FM channels. All we want is the Nashville channel back on air. Not coming from our computers or phones. Kinda hard to crank up the volume on your phone. Take notice of the hundreds of people who have already cancelled their service. If we all follow suit, you could lose many formerly loyal customers. Also check out the facebook page-Bring back Nashville57 to siriusxm radio. Please take our concerns into consideration. This can work out so that everyone gets what they want.

you tell us to use iheart radio, but alot of us dont have fancy phones or live in great cell service area to listen to it in our cars
You can't be serious.

So let me get this straight.....I have been paying for XM radio in 4 vehicles so I can listen to commercial free radio, and in particular, The Nashville Channel, but now you have replaced that channel with a commercial-laden channel.  It would appear that I am paying for the privilege of listening to commercials that someone else is paying you to air.  That doesn't seem right to me for some reason.  If I wanted to listen to everyday FM radio, I would dial up one of your 800 or so stations, KZSN in Wichita and give them a listen, as I sometimes do.  But, I am not having to pay for the right to listen to them.  You offer iheartradio.com.  Last time I looked, most vehicles don't come with a PC and unlimited web access, nor does everyone have an unlimited data plan, nor does everyone wish to invest MORE money to add the technology to their vehicle to access that product.  Y'all need to stick your head out of your corner office windows, look around, and pay attention to what the paying public wants.  Bring back "The Nashville Channel" to XM radio...There is plenty of space available.

Really?  GO spend MORE money for a Smart phone or adapter to listen to my XM57???  I just paid for a lifetime subscription to XM so I didn't have to go a weekday morning without them!!!  Doesn't seem like I should have to do anything....  Seems to me that YOU guys are the ones taking away a listener's favorite station.  Have you noticed the Facebook page?  Only a couple days old already over 1300 people have joined:

Listening to iHeartradio.com does me NO good in my vehicle! And to listen through my phone would cost me way too much for data usage. You've obviously got thousands of angry people. We will NOT be renewing our THREE subscriptions if you don't give us back the Nashville channel. We don't care what the traffic is in Nashville or what goes on there. And satellite radio is supposed to be commercial FREE, it says it right on the SiriusXM website, well WSIX has commercials. We want the kind of music that is on Nashville, Prime Country and the Highway play the same kind of music that I can listen to for FREE. We want they type of country that isn't on those stations. Please reconsider removing the Nashville channel from the lineup.

Honestly, I am OFFENDED that this is the response you have put out to the MANY listeners that are demanding NASHVILLE 57 be returned to SiriusXM!! I purchase a 2011 Chevy Suburban that comes with a SiriusXM 6 month trial.  The one channel that made it worth it to me to pay for the subscription is taken away & replaced with a regular old FM station that plays almost the exact same format as The Highway. Not to mention a station that people in the Nashville area get for free! Now, you want to tell me that to continue to hear the station that I paid for, I need to either purchase a newer phone & pay for a data package (for the IHEARTRADIO app), a laptop (for IHEARTRADIO online) or an audio adapter?? I happen to have a home computer that handles my computer needs.  We are a family of 7 with one working adult. We pay for a SiriusXM subscription for one car. In times like these it isn't in our budget to buy new gadgets & increase our phone package to accomodate data use. Why should it cost the hard working, paying subscribers any more money than it already does to hear the music we want to hear?  We have called & emailed & get the same canned responses over & over! We once lived in a time where the customers mattered. Your decision to replace NASHVILLE 57 with a free FM station makes it clear that you do not value the opinions of the customers.  If you doubt that this decision has caused an uproar to SiriusXM customers, please feel free to check out the facebook group BRING BACK NASHVILLE 57 TO SIRIUSXM RADIO! There are over 1300 people there that will glady share their opinion of this decision with you!!! I haven't been able to find a group that are standing in support of the decision to take away NASHVILLE 57 - maybe because NO ONE thinks this was a sound decision.  BRING BACK NASHVILLE 57!!!!

Bring back Nashville 57, no other country station plays music from the fresh new talent who need and deserve to be heard!!  And to think that I was ready to get SiriusXM for in my home too..ha! No way now, matter of fact I'm cancelling my subscription if Nashville 57 stays gone..what a shame, you really dropped the ball on this one Clear Channel!
Bring Back Nashville57 to SiriusXM Radio
I'd certainly be interested in knowing that you brought back Nashville57.  Why again are we paying for free music?
